page.title: 16Windmill Press: Kingswood
page.content: The Windmill Press is situated amongst woodland. Building was finished in 1928 and is in red brick in Georgian style. The sight was chosen by{Heinemann Press}(who still own the building today) who wanted a pleasant working place for their workers. Today they offer{employment}to the area with a staff of aproximately 215. In 1965 the printing division moved out to a more modern factory in Crawley, and the Windmill Press at Kingswood was given over to packaging, accounts and administration, a use which it still serves today. Eventually the printing works itself moved to London . The site at Kingswood is still suitable; being close to London, with good land and air{communications.
